text.p: The following is a factfile on Croatia's Iva Majoli, winner of the French Open on Saturday:
Aged seven: Started playing tennis with older brother and sister.
Aged nine: Began playing competitive tennis.
Aged 12: Moved to United States to attend Nick Bollettieri's tennis academy in Florida.
Aged 15: Made her Grand Slam debut at U.S. Open.
Aged 17: Won first career title in Zurich. The following week won her second career tournament in Filderstadt, Germany. Victory moved her into top 10 for first time in career.

Had won two titles this year in Hanover and Hamburg before the French Open and will rise to fifth in the world rankings after this tournament. Energetic player who prefers to stay at the baseline, Majoli is another of the clutch of younger players starting to emerge from the shadow of Steffi Graf and Monica Seles.

Seeding: 9. Age: 19. Plays right-handed (two-handed backhand). Weight: 61 kg. Height: 1.73m. Ranking: 9. Tournament wins: 6. Career prize money: $2.91 million (includes $654,115 for winning French Open).
